awd_titl_txt: Intelligent Computer Aided Design Methodology:  Mold        Thermal System Design as a Model
awd_abstract_narration: Many engineering design problems involve complicated                       physical phenomen a that frequently compel designers to use                     trial-and-error methods to arrive at a design that can be                       manufactured.  Design methodologies are needed that combine the                 analytical capabilities available from computers with the                       reasoning abilities of human experts.                                                   The goal of this research is to create an intelligent                   computer-aided design methodology for mold thermal system                       design.  The proposed design methodology will incorporate                       optimization techniques and the human decision making process                   in an interactive computer-aided design and analysis system.                    The long-term goal of the research is to increase our                           understanding of the role of computer and human expertise in                    computer-aided design and manufacturing.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
